note.note-paragraph: For the purposes of this subclass, the term "nail" is to be understood as including pin, bolt, and plug
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: hammers per se B25D; nailing machines B27F7/02

CPC-specific-text.text: for corrugated nails and marking tags
generated by detonation of a pellet

title-part.text: generated by detonation of a cartridge

CPC-specific-text.text: Cartridge ejecting mechanisms and latch mechanisms

title-part.text: acting on an intermediate plunger or anvil

reference.text: pistols for slaughtering or stunning animals A22B3/02

title-part.text: Cartridges specially adapted for impact tools
Details and accessories, e.g. splinter guards, spall minimisers

CPC-specific-text.text: Arrangements at the forward end of the barrel, e.g. splinter guards, spall minimisers, safety arrangements, silencers, bolt retainers

title-part.text: Portable devices for holding and guiding nails

CPC-specific-text.text: nail dispensers with provision for holding and guiding nails
the nail being hit by a hammer head
the nail being hit by a hammer head

reference.text: details or components, e.g. casings, bodies, of portable power-driven tools not particularly related to the operation performed B25F5/00; stapling machines B27F7/17

note.note-paragraph: In this group the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "stapling tools" covers tools for driving U-shaped loops, e.g. of metallic material, into a surface to fix an object thereto, or through layers of relatively thin material to hold them together, e.g. by clinching

title-part.text: with provision for bending the ends of the staples on to the work

CPC-specific-text.text: Stapling tools of the table model type, i.e. tools supported by a table or the work during operation
manually operated having a plunger cooperating with an anvil
having a pivoting upper leg and a leg provided with an anvil supported by the table or work
without an anvil, e.g. using staples of particular shape bent during the stapling operation without the use of external clinching means
having pivoting clinching means for bending the staple ends
Hand-held stapling tools, e.g. manually operated, i.e. not resting on a working surface during operation
with the objects to be stapled together introduced perpendicularly to the longitudinal axis of the tool in an opening formed by an anvil and a plunger

title-part.text: with means for forming the staples in the tool
without provision for bending the ends of the staples on to the work
with means for forming the staples in the tool

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. with feeding means, supports for staples or accessories concerning feeding devices
for tools with provision for bending the ends of the staples or to the work
with means for holding puller out of position during re-loading
with means for holding pusher out of position during re-loading
for feeding a chosen number of staples to the drive channel
Supports for the staples being fed
allowing the feeding of a variety of elements
with means for preventing jamming or aiding unjamming within the drive channel
preventing jamming by retaining the next staple
unjamming by movement of the feeding device
comprising storing arrangements for a plurality of staple strips
with means for indicating the number of staples remaining
co-ordinating with the feed of a second item
Staple support displaceable relative to the tool to allow re-loading

title-part.text: Accessories for nailing or stapling tools, e.g. supports

reference.text: for tools operated by detonation of a cartridge B25C1/18
